original: Axelson, Erik Axel, läroverksadjunkt, Linköping, f. 8/10/97 i Nyköp. av Johan A. o. Anna Rupman. — Stud:ex. i Nyköp. 16, fil. kand. i Upps. 19, fil. mag. 22, provår v. norra latin i Sthlm 27-28. Res. t. Tyskl. 22, 31-32 o. 35-39, Österr., Ital., Tjeckoslov. o. Tyskl. 23, Norge o. Finl. 26, Skottl., Engl., Frankr. o. Tyskl. 29, Danm. 30, Finl., Balticum, Polen, Tyskl. o. Danm. 33, Span. o. Schiveiz 34. E. lär. i Nyköp. 20-21, 22-24, 25-27 o. 28-29, adj. i modersm., hist. o. geogr. v. Linköp. h. a. 1. sed. 29. Södermanl.-När-kes nat. i Upps. andre kurator 22. Medl. av SHT o. Rotarykl. Vinnare av Svenisfca Daigbl. briidgemiäsiteirislk. 44.
translated: Axelson, Erik Axel, high school teacher, Linköping, born October 8th, 1897 in Nyköping, son of Johan A. and Anna Rupman. He graduated from Nyköping high school in 1916, received his bachelor's degree from Uppsala University in 1919, his master's degree in 1922, and worked as a substitute teacher at Norra Latin in Stockholm for the years 1927-28. He traveled to Germany in 1922, 1931-32, and 1935-39, Austria, Italy, Czechoslovakia, and Germany in 1923, Norway and Finland in 1926, Scotland, England, France, and Germany in 1929, Denmark in 1930, Finland, the Baltic States, Poland, Germany, and Denmark in 1933, Spain and Switzerland in 1934. He was a teacher in Nyköping from 1920-21, 1922-24, 1925-27, and 1928-29, and then a high school teacher in Linköping, teaching Swedish, history, and geography, starting in 1929. He was the second board member of the Södermanland-Närke national chapter of Uppsala's student union in 1922, and was a member of SHT and Rotary Club. He won the Svenisfca Daigbl. bridge championship in 1944.

memberOf.name: Södermanland-Närke national chapter of Uppsala's student union
